article_node.title: For Two or Three Days, a Surfer’s Paradise in New York City
article_node.summary: On a chilly and misty Thursday morning on Long Island, surfers were treated to exceptional wave conditions as Hurricane Erin approached the East Coast. Despite the unseasonably cold weather, a lone surfer caught an impressive eight-foot wave, showcasing the rare summer surfing opportunities that New York surfers eagerly anticipate. This event highlights the unique thrill of surfing in New York, even during less favorable conditions.
